title: [YSQL] Support `name` and `text` column comparison on DocDB

labels.name: kind/enhancement
labels.description: This is an enhancement of an existing feature

body:
Jira Link: [DB-13295](https://yugabyte.atlassian.net/browse/DB-13295)
### Description

YB has some gaps in cross-type comparison:
```
create table like_test(v name);
create index on like_test(v asc);
insert into like_test values ('aa'), ('ab'), ('ac'), ('ad'), ('ba'), ('bb'), ('bc'), ('bd');

explain (analyze, dist, summary off) select * from like_test t where v >= 'b'::name;
                                  QUERY PLAN
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Index Only Scan using like_test_v_idx on like_test t (actual rows=4 loops=1)
   Index Cond: (v >= 'b'::name)
   Storage Index Rows Scanned: 4
(5 rows)

explain (analyze, dist, summary off) select * from like_test t where v >= 'b'::text;
                                  QUERY PLAN
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Index Only Scan using like_test_v_idx on like_test t (actual rows=4 loops=1)
   Index Cond: (v >= 'b'::text)
   Rows Removed by Index Recheck: 4
   Storage Index Rows Scanned: 8
(6 rows)
```

In the second query, we read all 8 rows from the index because we don't even send the index condition with the request!

Both vanilla and YB PG11 decomposes a `name_col LIKE ‘a%’` condition into index conditions using a name const:
```
explain (analyze, dist, summary off) select * from like_test t where v like 'a%';
                               QUERY PLAN

                                  QUERY PLAN
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Index Only Scan using like_test_v_idx on like_test t (actual rows=4 loops=1)
   Index Cond: ((v >= 'a'::name) AND (v < 'b'::name))
   Storage Filter: (v ~~ 'a%'::text)
   Storage Index Rows Scanned: 4
(6 rows)
```
Since we're comparing a name column to a name value, DocDB can evaluate this so we only read 4 rows.
Both vanilla and YB PG15 also decompose the complex operator, but instead of casting 'a' and 'b' to name, they are casted to text.
```
explain (analyze, dist, summary off) select * from like_test t where v like 'a%';
                                  QUERY PLAN
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Index Only Scan using like_test_v_idx on like_test t (actual rows=4 loops=1)
   Index Cond: ((v >= 'a'::text) AND (v < 'b'::text))
   Storage Filter: (v ~~ 'a%'::text)
   Storage Index Rows Scanned: 8
(6 rows)
```

Here we're comparing a name column to a text value, which we can't evaluate. So no index condition is sent with the request (similar to the first example), and we must read all the rows from the index.
